results.title: Blackberry subway jam
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Douglas MacDonald, Eunice Macaulay and Robert Doucet
results.brief_description: Animated version of the popular children’s story by Robert Munsch is about a young boy with a major problem: his apartment has become a subway station but his mother doesn’t believe him and blames him for the commuters’ mess. Jonathan takes his problem to City Hall and gets his first look at what bureaucratic bungling is all about. Munsch’s story is entitled Jonathan Cleaned Up—Then He Heard a Sound. Music by Alex Pauk. Voice and narration by Hannah Goodheart.

results.title: Blackbeard the pirate
results.creator_credit: Edmund Grainger, RKO Radio Pictures and Raoul Walsh
results.brief_description: Shot in Technicolour, this rousing swashbuckler set in the 17th century tells the story of Blackbeard who, while pillaging the high seas kidnaps the adopted daughter of Sir Henry Morgan, a high official in Jamaica, much to the dismay of her lover, an officer in the British navy. Swordplay and derring-do abound as the timid officer must fight to win back his love, even as Blackbeard duels with his arch-enemy Morgan, who is also a reformed pirate.

results.title: Blackbeard's ghost
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Robert Stevenson
results.brief_description: The legendary pirate Blackbeard is cursed to wander in limbo until he performs a good deed. He gets his chance when he decides to help a local college track team that hasn’t a ghost of a chance of winning! Cast includes Peter Ustinov, Dean Jones, Suzanne Pleshette, Elsa Lanchester. Based on the book by Ben Stahl.

results.title: Black, white and all shades of grey
results.brief_description: A well-acted, taut noir drama featuring a strong narrative supported by great lighting and controlled use of tone and colour. The work makes economic use of locations to evoke time and place.

results.title: Black widow
results.creator_credit: Harold Schneider, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Bob Rafelson
results.brief_description: A fascinating reworking of the film noir genre, with Teresa Russell performing the femme fatale Reni, who seduces then murders a string of unsuspecting men, and Debra Winger taking on the role of the unsatisfied FBI agent Alex. Alex’s investigation is complicated by her increasing obsession with Reni and the sexual tension between the two, which threatens to bring about the downfall of both. A gripping and intricate film that raises interesting questions about love, desire and death.

results.title: Black Tuesday
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and W. Batty
results.brief_description: A report on the disastrous bushfires on the outskirts of Hobart on the 7th of February, 1967. Shows scenes during the fires, the damage caused, and interviews with people involved. The temporary housing and rehabilitation of homeless fire victims is described.

results.title: Black tide
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Film Australia and David E. Barrow
results.brief_description: As a coastal dwelling nation, Australia has a lot to lose from any large oil spills. So far the nation has not suffered major sea pollution problems comparable with some maritime nations. As a form of protection of Australian waters against oil pollution, a co-ordinated National Plan has been devised by government agencies to be actioned immediately a threat of pollution arises. This film, sponsored by the Commonwealth Department of Transport describes the extent of that plan to protect Australian coastal ecosystems and economics. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.
